department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: tan with green glaze; round and flat; six exterior partitions and three interior partitions
text: Round partitioned dishes such as this tend to be found in Eastern Chin (317-420) tombs. The grooved rim suggests such objects originally had covers. References to this type of vessel by the Chin poet, Tso Ssu, suggest these partitioned dishes were used as a container for food such as relishes and other delicacies.
title: Partitioned Dish (ho)
